oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Likelihood Ratios for Multiple Levels of ELISA S/P Ratios in Dairy Herds Infected with Mycobacterium avium subsp. paratuberculosis (MAP)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Naugle, Larew
Saville, W.
Shulaw, W.
Wittum, T.
Brownlee, I.
Love, B.
Byrum, B.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: ELISA
SIP ratios
MAP infection
dairy herd
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Several researchers have advocated the quantitative evaluation of ELISA SIP ratios rather than relying on a single cutoff value to classify test results. Here, we present likelihood ratios that evaluate the risk of MAP infection for multiple levels of ELISA SIP ratios for cows originating from MAP-infected dairy herds.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2003; 162
